full_text:
OFNARRM1
CASE# 06049528
PALM B. CH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFIC
ORIGINAL
OFFENSE REPORT
04/06/06
PAGE 1
ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO ______________ DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION.
I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT ______________ HAD CONTACTED THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, ______________, HAD FLED THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT.
UPON MY ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE ______________ REPORTED THAT ______________ HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT.  THEN STATED THAT AROUND 5:45 AM ON TODAY'S DATE, HIS TWIN'S DAUGHTER, ______________ AND ______________, HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING OUT ALL NIGHT.  ______________ STATED THAT HE BELIEVE THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE BLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILUTED.
STATED THAT ______________ GOT DRESSED AND HE DROPPED HER OFF AT SCHOOL, HOWEVER, A SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, ______________ CALLED HIM IN ORDER
<PF1> <PA2> <PF15> <PF22> <PF23>
RETURN BWD 1ST PAGE PREV SUPL NEXT SUPL
07/26/17 Page 88 of 124 Public Records Request No.: 17-295
DOJ-OGR-00031809

PAGE 1

ON MARCH 31, 2006 AT APPROXIMATELY 0925 HOURS, I RESPONDED TO ______________ DRIVE, IN LOXAHATCHEE, IN REFERENCE TO A MISSING PERSON INVESTIGATION.
I WAS ADVISED BY DISPATCH THAT ______________ HAD CONTACTED THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE IN ORDER TO REPORT THAT HIS DAUGHTER, ______________, HAD FLED THE RESIDENCE ON FOOT IN AN UNKNOWN DIRECTION OF TRAVEL DURING A VERBAL ARGUMENT.
UPON MY ARRIVAL TO THE RESIDENCE ______________ REPORTED THAT ______________ HAD RETURNED AND WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE PACKING HER CLOTHING IN ORDER TO MOVE OUT.  THEN STATED THAT AROUND 5:45 AM ON TODAY'S DATE, HIS TWIN'S DAUGHTER, ______________ AND ______________, HAD SNUCK BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE AFTER BEING OUT ALL NIGHT.  ______________ STATED THAT HE BELIEVE THEY WERE DROPPED OFF BY A YOUNG DRUG DEALER, AND UPON THEIR ARRIVAL WERE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF A NARCOTIC AS THEY COULD BARELY STAND UP, THEIR EYES WERE BLOODSHOT, AND THEIR PUPILS WERE DILUTED.
STATED THAT ______________ GOT DRESSED AND HE DROPPED HER OFF AT SCHOOL, HOWEVER, A SHORT TIME LATER, THE SCHOOL POLICE OFFICER, ______________ CALLED HIM IN ORDER

organizations: PALM B. CH COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFIC

additional_notes: The document contains multiple redactions, indicating sensitive information has been removed. The document is an Offense Report from the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office, dated April 6, 2006, regarding a missing person investigation.
